sentences.en: a crackdown on fare dodgers on trains
sentences.cn: 对火车逃票者的严厉打击

sentences.en: Air fares have shot up by 20%.
All we can offer you is humble fare.
sentences.cn: 就请你粗茶淡饭凑合一顿.

sentences.en: He could barely afford the fare.
He could barely afford the railway fare.
He couldn't afford the fare to Australia, so he worked his passage.
sentences.cn: 他负担不起去澳大利亚的船费, 因此,他在船上做工以抵偿船费.

sentences.en: How did you fare in London?
In second class the fare is £85 one-way.
sentences.cn: 二等车厢单程票价是85英镑。

sentences.en: It is unlikely that the marine industry will fare any better in September.
sentences.cn: 海运业不大可能在9月份有所好转。

sentences.en: She rowed the driver about the fare.

sentences.cn: 优惠往返机票价格为195英镑。

sentences.en: The fare here is simple but good.
sentences.cn: 这里的伙食简单而可口.

sentences.en: The round-trip fare to Havana is 550 Irish punts ($673).
sentences.cn: 去哈瓦那的往返票价是550爱尔兰镑（673美元）。

sentences.en: There was enough put by for her fare.
sentences.cn: 存的钱足够付她的机票钱。

sentences.en: They quoted 756 dollars for the single New York — London fare.
sentences.cn: 他们对纽约到伦敦的单程机票开价是756美元.

sentences.en: Yesterday he changed his tune, saying the fare increase was experimental.
sentences.cn: 昨天他变卦了，说提价只是试行。

phrases.tran_cn: 飞机票价；航空费用；航空票价
公共汽车票钱；公车票；公车费率

trans.tran_cn: 车费，票价，餐点，出租车乘客
trans.tran_en: the price you pay to travel somewhere by bus, train, plane etc
If you say that someone or something fares well or badly, you are referring to the degree of success they achieve in a particular situation or activity
